page.title: 10Clubs
page.content: In Tredegar the most important club is Rugby Club. The members of this club vary from seven year old to the grandfathers and great-grandfathers. The clubs in Tredeger are mostly drinking clubs which you have to be 18 or over to join. There are youth clubs in the chapels, which are open in the evening. The activities are varied, games, quizzes and sports. These clubs are open once or twice a week and are for the children 6 years old to 14 years old. The chapel clubs are organised by people from the chapel. The Leisure Centre holds most club activities, skating, swimming, art and craft, badminton and other sports. There are many clubs in Tredegar for many different people, First Aid, Brownies, martial arts, gardening and local history.
